oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Impacts of Alternative Implementations of the Single Farm Payment on Organi-cally and Conventionally Producing Farms in Austria
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schmid, Erwin
Sinabell, Franz
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Policy environments and social economy
Farming Systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In 2003, the Common Agricultural Policy underwent a substantial reform. Direct pay-ments that were linked to the production of certain crops and livestock were abolished. Alternatively, the Single Farm Payment was introduced in EU-15 Member States. We investigate the distributional consequences of alternative implementation choices for organic farms in Austria. Results show that net-returns of farms and the distribution of farm revenues depend on the particular implementation of the reform.
